title: 'Rebel botanists' in Plymouth identify urban plants
description: A group of amateur botanists are on a mission to sniff out so-called weeds on verges and pavements.

title: Can artificial intelligence create a decent dinner?
description: By checking what's in your fridge artificial intelligence can create new recipes, but do they work?

title: India's 'lockdown film' is an edgy thriller
description: A suspense thriller made at home during the coronavirus lockdown is receiving critical praise.

title: Amazon's murky world of one-star reviews
description: Companies are trying to manipulate online feedback - and one-star reviews have become the latest weapon.

title: US 2020 Election: Does Joe Biden support defunding the police?
description: Trump claims his rival wants to take money away from police, but Biden denies supporting the policy.

title: Is Italian fashion racist?
description: Italian designer Stella Jean says more needs to be done to tackle racism in the industry.

title: 'They shot him in cold blood'
description: Outrage in South Africa over the killing by police of a 16-year-old with Down's syndrome

title: Meet Australia's whisky-loving vegan who packs a microwave in his suitcase
description: Why leg-spinner Adam Zampa's eclectic interests mean he only has room for "three T-shirts and two pairs of pants" in his suitcase.

title: Lockdown job loss: Leeds station CV man gets interviews
description: Trevor Walford, 63, held up a sign in Leeds asking for work after losing his job amid the pandemic.

title: Australian flying foxes 'among Earth's most mobile mammals'
description: Australian species roam over massive distances and help the land recover from fire, research finds.

title: Manchester Arena Inquiry: Hearings begin into terror attack
description: The Manchester Arena bombing inquiry looks at whether there were missed opportunities to take action.

title: FA probes claims England players broke quarantine
description: Allegations England's Phil Foden and Mason Greenwood broke quarantine rules in Iceland are being investigated by the FA.

title: New Brexit law will not 'tear up' EU trade plans
description: No 10 confirms new legislation could change trade rules in Northern Ireland, but deny the measures are extreme.

title: Birmingham stabbings: Man arrested on suspicion of murder
description: A 27-year-old man is arrested in the early hours in the Selly Oak suburb of the city.

title: Kesgrave student injured in shooting on walk to school
description: A teenage boy has been arrested in connection with the shooting of the Year 11 student.

title: Coronavirus: Young people breaking rules risk ‘second wave’
description: The health secretary says new coronavirus spikes in France and Spain started with young people.

title: Lewis Hamilton: 'I hold myself accountable for missing signs'
description: Lewis Hamilton says he considers himself responsible for the penalty that cost him victory in the Italian Grand Prix.

title: Callum Wilson: Newcastle sign England striker from Bournemouth
description: Newcastle United sign England striker Callum Wilson for about £20m from Bournemouth on a four-year-deal.

title: Buttler to miss final Australia T20 to be with family
description: England batsman Jos Buttler asks to see his family after spending 10 weeks away from home in the bio-secure bubble.

title: Emma Barnett to present Radio 4's Woman's Hour
description: The 5 Live presenter will fill the shoes of Jane Garvey and Jenni Murray.

title: Manchester City: Riyad Mahrez & Aymeric Laporte test positive for coronavirus
description: Manchester City winger Riyad Mahrez and defender Aymeric Laporte test positive for coronavirus and must self-isolate.

title: Ethan Is Supreme: Beauty influencer Ethan Peters dies aged 17
description: Ethan Peters, also known as Ethan Is Supreme, was a makeup influencer and YouTuber from the US.

title: Novak Djokovic apologises after hitting line judge with ball at US Open
description: Novak Djokovic apologises for hitting a line judge with a ball at the US Open, saying he is "extremely sorry for creating her such stress".

title: Primark post-lockdown sales head for £2bn
description: Owner AB Foods says the High Street chain's sales since reopening have been stronger than expected.

title: US Open: Naomi Osaka beats Anette Kontaveit to reach quarter-finals
description: Two-time Grand Slam winner Naomi Osaka beats Anette Kontaveit in straight sets to reach the last eight of the US Open.

title: The Papers: PM's EU trade deal deadline makes front pages
description: Boris Johnson is reported saying No Deal could also be a "good outcome" for the UK.

title: Coronavirus: India overtakes Brazil in Covid-19 cases
description: India, which has been adding record daily totals, now has the world's second-highest tally.

title: Taliban peace talks: What to expect from the new round?
description: Afghans hope they will finally move towards peace after a prisoner release paves the way for talks.
